platform.game

Class Actor

  • java.lang.Object
    • platform.game.Actor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Actor>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Arrow, BackgroundImage, Block, Bomb, Debris, End, Eraser, Exit, Fireball, Heart, Image, Jumper, Key, Level, Lever, Limits, Oscillator, Overlay, Particle, Player, Spike, Torch

    public abstract class Actor
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Actor>, java.io.Serializable
    Base class of all simulated actors, attached to a world.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      private java.lang.String spriteName
      The name of the Actor's Sprite.
      private World world
      All spawned actors have a direct link with their World

    • Field Detail

      • serialVersionUID

        private static final long serialVersionUID
        Present for all Serializable classes (also all subclasses of Actor). This ID is used to compare serialised data to existing classes.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • world

        private World world
        All spawned actors have a direct link with their World

      • box

        private Box box
        All Actors are characterised by a Box. The box can also be null (invisible Actors).

      • spriteName

        private java.lang.String spriteName
        The name of the Actor's Sprite. The name of the Sprite can be null (invisible Actors)

    • Constructor Detail

      • Actor

        public Actor(Box box,
             java.lang.String spriteName)
        Base constructor of an Actor.
        Parameters:
        box - Indicates the position and the size of an Actor
        spriteName - Indicates which file should be used to draw it

      • Actor

        public Actor(Box box)
        Secondary constructor of an Actor.
        Parameters:
        box - Indicates the position and the size of an Actor

        Secondary constructor of an Actor.

    • Method Detail

      • getWorld

        protected World getWorld()
        Returns the Actor's World.
        Returns:
        the World linked to the Actor

      • register

        public void register(World world)
        Registers this actor by setting its World to the World entered.
        Parameters:
        world - Instance of world which will be linked to the Actor.
        See Also:
        Simulator

      • unregister

        public void unregister()
        Unregisters this actor by setting its World to null.

        public void preUpdate(Input input)
        Used to update the Actor before it interacts with the World.
        Parameters:
        input - Can be used to analyse input.
        See Also:
        Simulator, World

      • interact

        public void interact(Actor other)
        Used to simulate the interactions between all Actors.
        Parameters:
        other - other Actor with which this Actor has to interact.
        See Also:
        Simulator, World

      • draw

        public void draw(Input input,
                 Output output)
        Used to draw the Actor onto the World.
        Parameters:
        input - Can be used to analyse input.
        output - Can be used to output, e.g., the Sprite of the Actor
        See Also:
        Simulator, World

      • postUpdate

        public void postUpdate(Input input)
        Used to update the Actor after it has been drawn onto the World.
        Parameters:
        input - Can be used to analyse input.
        See Also:
        Simulator, World

      • getPriority

        protected abstract int getPriority()
        Classification criteria for all Actors. Has to be defined by each and everyone of them. This method makes this class abstract, so non instantiable.
        Returns:
        an integer used to classify all Actors by importance.

      • isSolid

        public boolean isSolid()
        Determines the solidity-status of the Actor.
        Returns:
        whether the Actor is solid or not (used in interactions), default false

      • hurt

        public boolean hurt(Actor instigator,
                    Damage type,
                    double amount,
                    Vector location)
        Used in interactions between Actors
        Parameters:
        instigator - Actor responsible for the attack
        type - type of the attack
        amount - amount of damage dealt by the attack
        location - location of the instigator of the attack
        Returns:
        whether the Actor has been hurt by an attack, default false

        the Actor's box.

      • getPosition

        public Vector getPosition()
        Returns the position of the Actor.
        Returns:
        the position of the Actor, which is defined by the center of its Box

      • getSprite

        Returns:
        Sprite corresponding to name

      • getSprite

        protected Sprite getSprite()
        Returns the Actor's Sprite.
        Returns:
        Sprite corresponding to the name of the Sprite already stored in Actor.

      • copie

        public Actor copie()
        Returns a "copy ready" instance of Actor
        Returns:
        a new instance of the same Actor. Used in button.Spawn. Null by default.
        See Also:
        Spawn

      • keyboardCode

        protected static int keyboardCode(int i)
        Gives the shortcut from all integers between 0 and 10.
        Parameters:
        i - integer between 0 and 10
        Returns:
        KeyEvent corresponding to the key i
        See Also:

      • delete

        protected static void delete(java.io.File file)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Deletes a file or a folder. Code inspired by the website cited.
        Parameters:
        file - can be a file or a folder.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If file not found, throw the corresponding exception.
        See Also:
